card.question: Vast, primordial void that existed prior to the creation of the universe, location of the original two worlds of fire and ice.
One of the two original worlds, the one of fire
One of the two original worlds, the one of ice
The father of the frost giants, spawned from fire and ice
A primordial icy cow from whose udders flowed four rivers of milk that nourished the early gods.
Generic name for a giant
A jötunn of fire that sprang from Ymir's sweat. During Ragnarök, he will come from the south with flames, carrying a very bright sword.

Literally, "final destiny of the gods". Refers to a series of major events, including a great battle foretold to ultimately result in the death of a number of the gods, the occurrence of various natural disasters, and the subsequent submersion of the world in water. Afterward, the world resurfaces anew and fertile, the surviving gods meet, and the world is repopulated by two human survivors.
The first god of Norse mythology. He was licked out of an ice block by the primordial cow Auðumbla. He was the father of Borr and hence the grandfather of Odin.
Son of Búri and father of Odin
The chief god, son of Borr. Associated with wisdom, war, battle, death, magic, poetry, prophecy, victory, and the hunt.
Odin's eight-legged horse. Son of Loki
Brothers of Odin
The first two humans
Two humans who survive the events of Ragnarök and repopulate the reborn world.
The world-tree
One of the two major groups of gods, which includes Odin, Frigg, Thor, Baldr, and Tyr.
One of the two major groups of gods, which includes Njörd, Freyr, and Freyja.
A god associated with light and beauty. Had the greatest ship ever built, Hringhorni. He was killed by an arrow made of mistletoe.
Son of Baldr and Nanna. God of justice, peace, and truth.
Goddess of love, beauty, and fertility. Wife of Óðr.
God of fertility, one of the Vanir. Brother of Freyja. Falls in love with the giantess Gerðr.
Wife of Odin. Goddess of marriage and motherhood.
Daughter of Loki, ruler of the underworld.
One of the Æsir gods, guardian of Ásgarð.
Home of the Æsir
A majestic, enormous hall located in Ásgarð, ruled over by the god Odin. Chosen by Odin, half of those that die in combat travel their upon death.
Our world, the places inhabited by humans, with the literal meaning "middle enclosure".
The bridge leading from Midgard, the realm of mortals, to Asgard, the realm of the gods. Guarded by Heimdall. Destroyed at Ragnarök, the end of the world.
Brother of Baldr, and his accidental killer.
Wisest of all the gods, formed from their saliva. Mudered by Fjalar and Galar, two dwarves, who mix his blood with honey and brew the Mead of Poetry.
One of the Æsir, a shapeshifter and trickster.
The Norns
card.answer: Urðr (fate) , Verðanði (the present) , and Skuld (the future)

card.question: Son of Odin, and god of thunder. Will kill Jörmunganðr, the world serpent, at Ragnarök, but then will walk nine paces and fall dead, poisoned by Jörmunganðr's venom
The god of single combat, victory and heroic glory. His right hand was bitten off by the wolf, Fenrir
A monstrous wolf, a son of Loki. Foretold to kill Odin at Ragnarök, but will then be killed by Odin's son Viðar.
A monstrous serpent, a son of Loki. Grew so large that he was able to encircle the earth. Will be killed by Thor at Ragnarök.
